required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Cholecalciferol Therapy in Alleviating Body Aches and Pains During Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Cholecalciferol Therapy in Alleviating Body Acheds and Pains During Pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to adapt the gold standard of research and adapt a randomized placebo-controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of vitamin D in alleviating chronic body aches and pains during pregnancy.and to explore the comparative bio availability and clinical efficacy of the two most commonly used forms of Cholecalciferol i.e ampoules and softgel capsules.

detailed_description.textblock: Vitamin D is a hormone synthesized in the skin in the presence of sunlight.Like other hormones,vitamin D plays a role in a wide range of processes in the body.This trial aims to review the possible role of vitamin D in nociceptive and inflammatory pain.In observational studies,low vitamin D levels have been associated with increased pain and higher opioid doses.Recent interventional studies have shown promising effects of vitamin D supplementation on cancer pain and muscular pain.Possible mechanisms for vitamin D in pain management are the anti-inflammatory effects mediated by reduced cytokine and prostaglandin E2(PGE2)is especially interesting and exhibits a credible mechanistic explanation.Studies have shown the increased prevalence of Vitamin D in pregnancy,which might lead to increased muscular aches and pains.Therefore,this study aims to evaluate the role of Vitamin D in alleviating chronic aches and pains during pregnancy.

primary_outcome.description: Using a ruler, the score is determined by mea-suring the distance (mm) on the 10-cm line between the "no pain" anchor and the patient's mark, providing a range of scores from 0-100. A higher score indicates greater pain intensity. SunnyD10000 IU softgel capsule

secondary_outcome.description: Most experts agree that 25(OH)D of < 20 ng/ml is considered to be vitamin D deficiency whereas a 25(OH)D of 21-29 ng/ml is considered to be insufficient. The goal should be to maintain both children and adults at a level > 30 ng/ml to take full advantage of all the health benefits that vitamin D provides. SunnyD10000 IU softgel capsule

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant women (20-24 weeks of gestation)
2. Age 20-40
3. Presence of body aches and pain falling in the pain chart defined
4. Vitamin D deficiency (serum 25(OH)D < 20 ng/ml)
5. Resident of Rawalpindi, Islamabad for easy follow up throughout the study period (3 months per participant)
6. Willingness and availability to show-up in the follow up visits and serum testing
Exclusion Criteria:
1. <20 weeks gestation
2. >24 weeks of gestation
3. Acute sharp pain
4. Presence of co-morbidities (gestational diabetes, Pregnancy Induced Hypertension, Anemia Hb <10.5)
5. Vitamin D sufficiency or moderate deficiency (serum 25(OH)D > 20 ng/ml)
6. Distant residents difficult to call for a follow
